resources.string: 24/7 Travel Assistance provides you with a wide range of free travel assistance benefits while you are traveling. You can access the emergency services 24/7 by calling 1-800-DISCOVER (1-800-347-2683) or 1-801-902-3100 if you are outside the U.S.
What benefits are included with 24/7 Travel Assistance?

Lost Luggage Tracking: We will help you locate lost luggage by staying in touch with your airline or other carrier, and provide regular status updates until your luggage is found. \nEmergency Cash Transfer: We will help you find the most easily obtainable funds and can locate ATMs and financial service institutions, or arrange to have cash wired or delivered while traveling. \nPassport and Travel Document Replacement: If your passport, identity cards or other papers necessary to return home are lost or stolen, our provider will offer assistance to replace them. \nFlight Rebooking/Ticket Replacement: If your tickets home are lost or stolen, or if illness or other emergency requires changing travel arrangements, our provider offers assistance replacing or rebooking your tickets.\n  \nLog into Discover.com to view all your travel benefits.
Where is my Discover card accepted outside of the U.S.?

Discover cards are currently accepted in multiple countries around the world through the Discover Network and our Network Partnerships: China Union Pay, JCB, and Diners Club International. Please visit our Country Acceptance Map on discover.com to select your travel destination from a full list of countries where Discover is accepted.
How do I contact the card service center when traveling outside of the U.S.?
We are open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. While outside of the U.S., you can reach us by calling 001 plus 801-902-3100.
What should I do if my card is lost or stolen while traveling abroad?
If your card is lost or stolen while traveling outside of the U.S. immediately contact the Customer Service Center in the U.S. by dialing 001 plus 801-902-3100.
How will foreign transactions appear on my statement?

Line 1 includes: 
-Name and location of the merchant and amount of transaction in U.S. dollars


Line 2 includes: 
-The amount of the transaction in the foreign currency
